page.title: 17CLOPHILL'S GEOLOGY
page.content: { Clophill}stands on the{greensand {ridge}which stretches from{Sandy,}in the east, to{Leighton Buzzard,}in the west. This is a{sandstone}much used in building and in roadmaking. The{River {Flitt}bisects our area and has left a fine{silt}over the aeons. With the fertile soil and good drainage it is an ideal place for vegetable growing. There are isolated patches of{gault {clay,}said to be{fossilised dinosaur {dung,}which has been used to make white bricks for local houses and indeed for the tile manufacture once a thriving industry in Kiln Lane. Other{clays}make red bricks. In the southern part of our area are valuable deposits of{fullers earth which have been extensively quarried in the past. As one of these is under our school we hope there is not a sudden national shortage of it.
